children.subject: Since you're still a junior (and I assume you have another year), you can still reach out to professors to get involved in their labs before applying. Your odds are much better if you are already doing the same research you would be during the MS, and even 6 months-1 year will help quite a bit. You can also have your non-Berkeley advisor write a supplemental letter of recommendation, which will give some weight to your prior work.

history.content:
I'm currently a Junior CS major interested in applying to the 5th Years Masters. I've heard the two most important factors for admission are GPA and Research Experience. I think my GPA is pretty good, I'm just concerned about the research experience. I've been working at a research lab for over a year, and have had my name co-authored on a published paper. The only issue is this lab is not affiliated with UC Berkeley in any capacity. 

Does anyone have any advice on what I should do? I've heard you need a UC Berkeley professor to sponsor your master's research. How can people end up doing this if they haven't already been researching with a professor for some time? Is my best plan to simply introduce myself to as many professors, tell them about my experience, and ask if they would sponsor me?

Any and all advice is appreciated!
history.subject: Fifth Years Masters Without UC Berkeley Research?
